Help:Node.title: Command Usage: put
Help:Node.Log:Description:
COMMAND USAGE: drop [object]; or $(keyword) [object] [preposition] [object]; or $(keyword) [object] in [container]
EXAMPLE: $(keyword) potato; $(keyword) potato near bench; $(keyword) potato in bag
Gets rid of an object that you are currently carrying. The easiest command is drop [object]; this will discard the object in your current location. You may also place an object in a specific proximity to another object (under a table, near a fireplace, by an altar); or you may put an object in a container (in sack).
Any of the following verbs may be used: cast, drop, insert, lay, lean, leave, move, pack, place, put, set, slam, stand, store, throw, and toss. Each produces slightly different output.
You may use any of the following prepositions: against, before, behind, beside, close, inside, near, on, over, under. Some objects will refuse some prepositions (ie, you might not be able to put things under a chest or behind a bookcase).
SEE ALSO: take
